thread.title: All The ‚ÄòBrown Girl‚Äô Instagrams You Need To Follow Right Away
thread.title_full: All The ‚ÄòBrown Girl‚Äô Instagrams You Need To Follow Right Away

title: All The ‚ÄòBrown Girl‚Äô Instagrams You Need To Follow Right Away
text:
facebook 
The #browngirl trend has been out and bout for a long time now. There is a huge rise in women of color as social media influencers and stars. These ladies are doing their best in making ‚Äòdesi' the new cool. Slaying the social media scene with makeup tips, funny memes, art, fashion and what not, all these ‚Äòbrown girls' are making it big in their own way. 
Now we wanted to make sure you knew of these ladies, sitting all across the globe and doing their own thing to make us proud. So we compiled a list of 10 best Instagram accounts working around the brown girl theme and killing it! 1. Hate Copy 
Artist Maria Qamar, gives a unique spin on Roy Lichtenstein's work known famously for his vibrant colored comic book style, and reminds us how ridiculous and funny desi culture is. A post shared by Maria (@hatecopy) on Feb 10, 2017 at 6:47am PST 2. Nimisha Bhanot 
Known for her badass Indian pinup art, Nimisha is now world famous. It all started as her response to the Jyoti Singh rape case that took place in Delhi, and now she is selling her art worldwide. A post shared by Art of Nimisha Bhanot (@nimishabhanot) on Nov 24, 2016 at 10:22am PST 3. Babbu the Painter 
Babneet Paul Lakhesar, born in Bhatinda, designs and paints clothes with tongue-in-cheek screen-printing, rainbow rickshaws and cool aunties. With influences ranging from Mughal era paintings to Bollywood, her pop art-esque fusion is traditional yet very unique. A post shared by B A B B U ‚ùñ (@babbuthepainter) on Jan 19, 2017 at 6:05pm PST 4. Curry Scented Bxtches 
The Instagram feed is full of beautiful brown faces being their unapologetic desi self. Must follow! A post shared by üë≥üë≥ Desi baddies (@curryscentedbxtches) on Feb 26, 2017 at 11:48am PST 5. Artwhoring 
Taking a stand on feminism, Priyanka Paul, an 18 year old from Bombay makes some amazing and thoughtful art that you have to see! A post shared by Priyanka Paul (@artwhoring) on Dec 3, 2016 at 5:50am PST 6. The Pakistani Martha Stewart 
Saher, living in the US, goes by this very catchy name and makes art inspired from the conservative lives and thinking that our desi parents abide by. She even sells her own merch that sells out like hot cakes! A post shared by Saher (@thepakistanimarthastewart) on Feb 6, 2017 at 7:30am PST 7. Jasmine Lakhesar 
The queen of make-up Jasmine has been loves her work to be inspired from her homeland. One of her most iconic looks has to be the one inspired from Hate Copy's ‚ÄòBad Beti'! A post shared by ‚†Ä‚†Ä J A S M I N E (@jasminelakhesar) on Oct 22, 2016 at 2:58pm PDT 8. Binti International 
Talking about period shaming, this forum is believes in taking a stand and doing something about the cause. If this wasn't enough, you can follow them for the hilarious memes they post about brown girls and other related things! A post shared by Binti International (@binti.period) on Feb 25, 2017 at 4:07am PST 9. Kamaapp 
Although an app for South Asian people, the Instagram page for this one is full of funny art and memes from all over the world. This one just can't be missed! A post shared by Kama - South Asian Dating (@kamaapp) on Aug 9, 2016 at 12:17pm PDT 10. Aankita Banerjee 
Another makeup artist, Aankita loves to dress Indian and more often than not, gives it her own twist which is fun to follow! A post shared by Ankita (@aankita.b) on Feb 16, 2017 at 11:41am PST
